description: note - name changed from Intergovernmental Maritime Consultative Organization (IMCO) on 22 May 1982 6 March 1948 set up as the Inter-Governmental Maritime Consultative Organization; effective - 17 March 1958 to deal with international maritime affairs; a UN specialized agency members - (174) includes all UN member countries except Afghanistan, Andorra, Bhutan, Botswana, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Central African Republic, Chad, Eswatini, Kyrgyzstan, Laos, Lesotho, Liechtenstein, Mali, Federated States of Micronesia, Niger, Rwanda, South Sudan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan; and the Cook Islands associate members - (3) Faroe Islands, Hong Kong, Macau
